author: DispatchDaemon
title: Editorial: SAVANNAH CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL: Willets' generous gift makes hospital's dream reality | savannahnow.com
text:
Thanks to the generous donation by Dwaine and Cynthia Willett, the new children’s hospital at Memorial Hospital has a new name and has moved closer to reaching the goal of Memorial’s two year capital campaign.
Last week, the Memorial Health Foundation announced the Willetts have made a $5 million gift to the Children’s Hospital of Savannah, which will be named in the couple’s honor.
“For many years, we’ve wanted to build a freestanding hospital to better serve children on our campus, and this generous gift from the Willetts will help make this dream a reality,” said Jackie Rabinowitz, Memorial Health board member and chair of the “Kids Only” capital campaign.
Now housed on the second and third floors of the main hospital building, the Dwaine and Cynthia Willett Children’s Hospital of Savannah is expected to open in spring 2017. The new freestanding facility will be placed in what is now the Savannah Rehabilitation Hospital on the Waters Avenue campus.
The rehabilitation hospital will be moved to a new location on Seawright Drive near Benedictine Military School.
The Memorial Health Foundation launched a five-year, $20 million “Kids Only” capital campaign for the Children’s Hospital at Savannah in February 2014. The campaign has raised more than $15 million so far. The Willetts’ contribution marks the largest single gift to the campaign.
The Willetts have been loyal supporters of Memorial’s pediatric programs for many years.
Cynthia Willett has been actively involved in the Children’s Hospital Charter Circle (for pediatric neurosurgery) and in fundraising for the “Kids Only” capital campaign. She serves as a trustee of the Memorial Health Foundation, the fundraising arm of Memorial Health, and recently co-chaired the successful Lowcountry Annie Oakleys Charity Clays for Children fundraiser.
“We are honored to continue our support of Memorial and to have the opportunity to donate to the new children’s hospital,” said Cynthia Willett. “My husband and I have a large family, and children’s causes have always been important to us.”
The Dwaine and Cynthia Willett Children’s Hospital of Savannah will play an important health care role for Chatham and surrounding counties. The hospital currently provides care for 70,000 students each year, with more than 4,300 inpatient admissions. The new facility will consolidate all pediatric inpatient units, the pediatric intensive care unit, a four-room surgical suite, pediatric ancillary services, a 24-hour pediatric emergency department and family support space.
In a statement following the announcement of the gift, Dwaine Willett, a longtime auto dealer in Florida and Georgia, noted the importance of the children’s hospital to his family and the surrounding community.
“It is our hope that the Willett Children’s Hospital of Savannah will be our legacy, benefiting children in our communities for many years to come,” he said.
The Willetts’ selfless gift has accomplished that mission.
